data.name: Minimum Coins
data.description:
Instructions:

  You have been given a function solve with two parameters: an integer x and a vector of integers coins. Your task   is to complete the function to find the minimum number of coins required to make the value x using the available   coin denominations.

Input:

    An integer x (1 ≤ x ≤ 10^5).
    A vector of integers coins (1 ≤ |coins| ≤ 100) representing different coin denominations available. Each coin   denomination is a positive integer within the range [1, 100].

Output:

    An integer representing the minimum number of coins needed to make the value x.

Example:

    int x = 11;
    std::vector<int> coins = {1, 2, 5};
    int result = solve(x, coins); // Output: 3 (2 coins of 5 + 1 coin of 1 = 11)
  
Note:

  There won't be any unsolvable problem
